info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 11:59AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Heavy rain will impact portions of northern Clark, Pike, western Lonoke, northern Grant, northwestern Jefferson, Garland, Saline, Hot Spring, Pulaski and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 130 PM CST... At 1158 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking an area of moderate to heavy rain with embedded thunderstorms along a line extending from near Glenwood to McAlmont. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Moderate to heavy rainfall and isolated flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding of water on roads, creeks out of their banks, nuisance flooding in urban areas. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... North Little Rock... Hot Springs... Benton... Sherwood... Jacksonville... Cabot... West Little Rock... Maumelle... Bryant... Hot Springs Village... Arkadelphia... Malvern... Downtown Little Rock... Sheridan... Lonoke... Murfreesboro... North Little Rock Airport... Little Rock AFB... Southwest Little Rock... This includes the following highways... Interstate 30 between mile markers 69 and 142. Interstate 40 between mile markers 144 and 176. Interstate 430 between mile markers 1 and 12. Interstate 530 between mile markers 1 and 21. Interstate 630 between mile markers 1 and 7. Interstate 440 between mile markers 1 and 14. US Highway 67 between mile markers 1 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these showers and storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
